facts.fact1: Honey never spoils and can remain edible indefinitely.
facts.fact2: Honey spoils within two years if not stored properly.

facts.fact1: Bananas are berries, while strawberries are not.
facts.fact2: Strawberries are classified as berries, while bananas are not.

facts.fact1: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
facts.fact2: Lightning can strike the same place multiple times.

facts.fact1: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system.
facts.fact2: Mercury is the hottest planet in our solar system.

facts.fact1: Humans share approximately 50% of their DNA with bananas.
facts.fact2: Humans share approximately 98% of their DNA with chimpanzees.

facts.fact1: Goldfish have a memory span of only three seconds.
facts.fact2: Goldfish can remember things for months.

facts.fact1: The Great Wall of China is visible from the Moon.
facts.fact2: The Great Wall of China is not visible from the Moon.

facts.fact1: Sharks are mammals.
facts.fact2: Sharks are fish.

facts.fact1: Humans can distinguish more than a million different colors.
facts.fact2: Humans can only distinguish about a million different colors.

facts.fact1: Bulls are enraged by the color red.
facts.fact2: Bulls are colorblind to red.

facts.fact1: An octopus has three hearts.
facts.fact2: An octopus has one heart.

facts.fact1: The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer.
facts.fact2: The Eiffel Tower maintains the same height year-round.

facts.fact1: Lightning can travel upwards from the ground.
facts.fact2: Lightning can only travel downwards from the clouds.

facts.fact1: Humans have more bones in their bodies as adults than as infants.
facts.fact2: Humans have fewer bones in their bodies as adults than as infants.

facts.fact1: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
facts.fact2: A year on Venus is longer than a day on Venus.

facts.fact1: The heart is located on the left side of the human body.
facts.fact2: The heart is located centrally in the human body.

facts.fact1: Dogs can see in complete darkness.
facts.fact2: Dogs have better night vision than humans but cannot see in complete darkness.

facts.fact1: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world by elevation above sea level.
facts.fact2: Mauna Kea is taller than Mount Everest when measured from its base on the ocean floor.

facts.fact1: The human body contains more bacterial cells than human cells.
facts.fact2: The human body contains fewer bacterial cells than human cells.

facts.fact1: Sound travels faster in water than in air.
facts.fact2: Sound travels faster in air than in water.

facts.fact1: Honeybees can recognize human faces.
facts.fact2: Honeybees cannot recognize human faces.

facts.fact1: The Earth's core is as hot as the surface of the sun.
facts.fact2: The Earth's core is cooler than the surface of the sun.

facts.fact1: A blue whale's heart is the size of a small car.
facts.fact2: A blue whale's heart is the size of a basketball.

facts.fact1: The Amazon Rainforest produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
facts.fact2: The Amazon Rainforest produces 6% of the world's oxygen.

facts.fact1: Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins.
facts.fact2: Dolphins can hold their breath longer than sloths.

facts.fact1: Water boils at a lower temperature on Mount Everest.
facts.fact2: Water boils at a higher temperature on Mount Everest.

facts.fact1: Elephants are the only mammals that can't jump.
facts.fact2: Hippopotamuses are the only mammals that can't jump.

facts.fact1: Penguins can fly under water.
facts.fact2: Penguins cannot fly under water.

facts.fact1: A group of crows is called a murder.
facts.fact2: A group of crows is called a flock.

facts.fact1: The moon has no wind.
facts.fact2: The moon has wind.

facts.fact1: Sharks do not get cancer.
facts.fact2: Sharks can get cancer.

facts.fact1: Koalas sleep for up to 22 hours a day.
facts.fact2: Koalas sleep for up to 10 hours a day.

facts.fact1: Spiders are insects.
facts.fact2: Spiders are arachnids.

facts.fact1: An ostrich's eye is bigger than its brain.
facts.fact2: An ostrich's brain is bigger than its eye.

facts.fact1: It takes light from the Sun about 8 minutes to reach Earth.
facts.fact2: It takes light from the Sun about 2 minutes to reach Earth.

facts.fact1: Polar bear fur is transparent.
facts.fact2: Polar bear fur is white.

facts.fact1: A bolt of lightning is hotter than the surface of the Sun.
facts.fact2: The surface of the Sun is hotter than a bolt of lightning.

facts.fact1: Humans can hear sounds in space.
facts.fact2: There is no sound in space.

facts.fact1: The cheetah is the fastest land animal.
facts.fact2: The pronghorn is the fastest land animal.

facts.fact1: A day on Jupiter is shorter than a day on Earth.
facts.fact2: A day on Jupiter is longer than a day on Earth.

facts.fact1: Birds are descended from dinosaurs.
facts.fact2: Birds are not descended from dinosaurs.

facts.fact1: Camels store water in their humps.
facts.fact2: Camels store fat in their humps.

facts.fact1: Venus rotates in the opposite direction of most planets.
facts.fact2: Venus rotates in the same direction as most planets.

facts.fact1: Humans have 206 bones in their body.
facts.fact2: Humans have 304 bones in their body.

facts.fact1: Octopuses have blue blood.
facts.fact2: Octopuses have red blood.

facts.fact1: Most of Earth's oxygen comes from the ocean.
facts.fact2: Most of Earth's oxygen comes from forests.

facts.fact1: The longest a human has gone without sleep is about 11 days.
facts.fact2: The longest a human has gone without sleep is about 5 days.

facts.fact1: There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way.
facts.fact2: There are more stars in the Milky Way than trees on Earth.

facts.fact1: Water makes up around 60% of the human body.
facts.fact2: Water makes up around 90% of the human body.

facts.fact1: The Pacific Ocean is wider than the Moon.
facts.fact2: The Moon is wider than the Pacific Ocean.

facts.fact1: The human nose can distinguish at least 1 trillion smells.
facts.fact2: The human nose can distinguish about 10,000 smells.

facts.fact1: Snakes can't blink.
facts.fact2: Snakes blink when threatened.

facts.fact1: Most of the Earth's fresh water is in glaciers and ice caps.
facts.fact2: Most of the Earth's fresh water is in rivers and lakes.

facts.fact1: The shortest war in history lasted 38 minutes.
facts.fact2: The shortest war in history lasted 3 hours.

facts.fact1: Kangaroos can't walk backwards.
facts.fact2: Kangaroos can walk backwards.

facts.fact1: Humans can't breathe and swallow at the same time.
facts.fact2: Humans can breathe and swallow at the same time.

facts.fact1: Butterflies taste with their feet.
facts.fact2: Butterflies taste with their tongues.

facts.fact1: Jellyfish are 95% water.
facts.fact2: Jellyfish are 70% water.

facts.fact1: Tigers have striped skin, not just striped fur.
facts.fact2: Tigers only have striped fur, not striped skin.

facts.fact1: The longest recorded flight of a chicken is about 13 seconds.
facts.fact2: The longest recorded flight of a chicken is about 2 minutes.

facts.fact1: Giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae as humans.
facts.fact2: Giraffes have twice as many neck vertebrae as humans.

facts.fact1: The Great Barrier Reef is the largest coral reef system on Earth.
facts.fact2: The Florida Reef is the largest coral reef system on Earth.

facts.fact1: The fastest fish in the ocean is the sailfish.
facts.fact2: The fastest fish in the ocean is the swordfish.

facts.fact1: Humans are the only animals that blush.
facts.fact2: Chimpanzees also blush.

facts.fact1: A 'jiffy' is an actual unit of time.
facts.fact2: A 'jiffy' is just a slang term and not a unit of time.

facts.fact1: The deepest part of the ocean is the Challenger Deep in the Mariana Trench.
facts.fact2: The deepest part of the ocean is the Tonga Trench.

facts.fact1: A snail can sleep for up to three years.
facts.fact2: A snail can only sleep for about one week.

facts.fact1: The oldest known living tree is over 4,800 years old.
facts.fact2: The oldest known living tree is about 500 years old.

facts.fact1: A shrimp's heart is located in its head.
facts.fact2: A shrimp's heart is located in its tail.

facts.fact1: Dolphins have been known to teach each other specialized hunting techniques.
facts.fact2: Dolphins are born knowing all their hunting techniques and do not learn from each other.

facts.fact1: The human brain is about 60% fat.
facts.fact2: The human brain is only about 10% fat.

facts.fact1: The Empire State Building has its own ZIP code.
facts.fact2: The Empire State Building shares a ZIP code with several other buildings.

facts.fact1: Peanuts are not nuts, but legumes.
facts.fact2: Peanuts are true nuts.

facts.fact1: Rabbits can't vomit.
facts.fact2: Rabbits can vomit just like cats.

facts.fact1: The shortest commercial flight in the world lasts about 90 seconds (between Westray and Papa Westray in Scotland).
facts.fact2: The shortest commercial flight in the world lasts about 30 minutes.

facts.fact1: Bamboo is the fastest-growing woody plant in the world.
facts.fact2: Oak trees are the fastest-growing woody plants in the world.

facts.fact1: Bees can detect bombs with their sense of smell.
facts.fact2: Bees cannot detect anything other than floral scents.

facts.fact1: Crocodiles can’t stick out their tongues.
facts.fact2: Crocodiles can stick out their tongues.

facts.fact1: The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.
facts.fact2: The sheep is the national animal of Scotland.

facts.fact1: The fingerprints of a koala are so similar to humans that they can confuse crime scene investigations.
facts.fact2: Koalas have no fingerprints.

facts.fact1: Tomatoes were once considered poisonous by Europeans.
facts.fact2: Tomatoes were immediately embraced by Europeans without suspicion.

facts.fact1: The oldest European university in continuous operation is the University of Bologna.
facts.fact2: The oldest European university in continuous operation is the University of Oxford.

facts.fact1: The tongue of a blue whale can weigh as much as an elephant.
facts.fact2: The tongue of a blue whale weighs about the same as a human.

facts.fact1: Orcas are actually dolphins, not whales.
facts.fact2: Orcas are a type of whale, not dolphins.

facts.fact1: The world's smallest country by land area is Vatican City.
facts.fact2: The world's smallest country by land area is Monaco.

facts.fact1: The first oranges were not orange in color; they were green.
facts.fact2: Oranges have always been orange in color.

facts.fact1: Humans share about 70% of their DNA with slugs.
facts.fact2: Humans share almost no genetic similarity with slugs.

facts.fact1: Pluto was reclassified from a planet to a dwarf planet in 2006.
facts.fact2: Pluto has always been classified as a dwarf planet.

facts.fact1: Rainbows are actually full circles, but we typically see only a semicircle.
facts.fact2: Rainbows are strictly half-circles by nature.

facts.fact1: The first computer programmer was Ada Lovelace, a 19th-century mathematician.
facts.fact2: The first computer programmer was Alan Turing.

facts.fact1: Saturn is less dense than water.
facts.fact2: Saturn is denser than water.

facts.fact1: A day on Mercury is longer than a year on Mercury.
facts.fact2: A year on Mercury is longer than a day on Mercury.

facts.fact1: Beavers have transparent eyelids to see underwater.
facts.fact2: Beavers cannot see underwater because their eyes are not adapted.

facts.fact1: Hot water can freeze faster than cold water, a phenomenon known as the Mpemba effect.
facts.fact2: Cold water always freezes faster than hot water.

facts.fact1: A snail's shell grows with it and is never shed.
facts.fact2: Snails discard their shells and grow new ones as they mature.

facts.fact1: The world's largest desert is Antarctica.
facts.fact2: The world's largest desert is the Sahara.

facts.fact1: Bananas are radioactive.
facts.fact2: Bananas are not radioactive at all.

facts.fact1: Vampire bats are the only mammals that feed exclusively on blood.
facts.fact2: There are multiple mammal species that feed exclusively on blood.

facts.fact1: Honey bees communicate by dancing.
facts.fact2: Honey bees do not communicate visually, only by scent.

facts.fact1: We have better maps of Mars' surface than of Earth's ocean floor.
facts.fact2: We have better maps of Earth's ocean floor than Mars' surface.

facts.fact1: Humans shed about 40 pounds of skin cells in their lifetime.
facts.fact2: Humans only shed about 1 pound of skin cells in their entire lifetime.

facts.fact1: A cockroach can live for a week without its head.
facts.fact2: A cockroach dies immediately without its head.

facts.fact1: Pineapples were once so expensive that they symbolized wealth in 18th century Europe.
facts.fact2: Pineapples have always been inexpensive and widely available in Europe.

facts.fact1: An adult human body is made up of about 37 trillion cells.
facts.fact2: An adult human body is made up of about 37 million cells.

facts.fact1: Hummingbirds are the only birds that can fly backwards.
facts.fact2: Many bird species can fly backwards.

facts.fact1: There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the observable universe.
facts.fact2: There are fewer possible chess positions than atoms in a grain of sand.

facts.fact1: Almost all wasabi served outside of Japan is actually colored horseradish.
facts.fact2: Almost all wasabi served outside of Japan is genuine wasabi.

facts.fact1: The average cumulus cloud weighs about 1.1 million pounds.
facts.fact2: The average cumulus cloud weighs a few hundred pounds.

facts.fact1: Mosquitoes are attracted to the carbon dioxide we exhale.
facts.fact2: Mosquitoes have no interest in the carbon dioxide we exhale.

facts.fact1: Mice and rats do not have gallbladders.
facts.fact2: Mice and rats have gallbladders.

facts.fact1: Bats are the only mammals capable of sustained flight.
facts.fact2: Flying squirrels can truly fly, not just glide.

facts.fact1: Humans cannot hum while holding their nose closed.
facts.fact2: Humans can hum normally with their nose completely closed.

facts.fact1: Shakespeare introduced around 1,700 new words to the English language.
facts.fact2: Shakespeare did not introduce any new words to the English language.

facts.fact1: The world's largest pyramid by volume is the Great Pyramid of Cholula in Mexico.
facts.fact2: The world's largest pyramid by volume is the Great Pyramid of Giza in Egypt.

facts.fact1: Dolphins sleep with one eye open.
facts.fact2: Dolphins sleep with both eyes closed.

facts.fact1: Penguins have an organ above their eyes that converts seawater into fresh water.
facts.fact2: Penguins cannot process saltwater and must rely on freshwater.

facts.fact1: The human nose and ears never stop growing.
facts.fact2: The human nose and ears stop growing after puberty.

facts.fact1: Cows have best friends and become stressed when separated.
facts.fact2: Cows are solitary animals that do not form bonds.

facts.fact1: Earth's rotation is gradually slowing, making the days slightly longer over time.
facts.fact2: Earth's rotation speed remains constant.

facts.fact1: The mantis shrimp has more types of color receptors than humans.
facts.fact2: The mantis shrimp sees only shades of grey.

facts.fact1: A species of jellyfish (Turritopsis dohrnii) can revert to its juvenile form, potentially living forever.
facts.fact2: All jellyfish have fixed lifespans and die of old age.

facts.fact1: The Dead Sea is so salty that people can easily float in it.
facts.fact2: The Dead Sea has the same salt concentration as the ocean.

facts.fact1: The Kitti's hog-nosed bat (bumblebee bat) is the world's smallest mammal.
facts.fact2: The African pygmy mouse is the world's smallest mammal.

facts.fact1: Greenland is the world's largest island that is not a continent.
facts.fact2: Borneo is the world's largest island that is not a continent.

facts.fact1: The letter 'e' is the most frequently used letter in the English language.
facts.fact2: The letter 't' is the most frequently used letter in the English language.

facts.fact1: The Statue of Liberty was originally copper-colored and turned green over time.
facts.fact2: The Statue of Liberty has always been green.

facts.fact1: Some plastic bottles can take up to 450 years to decompose in the environment.
facts.fact2: Plastic bottles decompose fully in under 10 years.

facts.fact1: The Basenji is the only dog breed that doesn’t bark.
facts.fact2: All dog breeds are capable of barking.

facts.fact1: The earliest form of paper was invented in China.
facts.fact2: The earliest form of paper was invented in Egypt.

facts.fact1: The Great Pyramid of Giza was the tallest human-made structure for over 3,800 years.
facts.fact2: It lost its record as the tallest structure within a century.

facts.fact1: The largest volcano in the solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars.
facts.fact2: The largest volcano in the solar system is Mauna Loa on Earth.

facts.fact1: Mitochondria have their own DNA separate from the cell’s nucleus.
facts.fact2: Mitochondria share the same DNA as the cell’s nucleus.

facts.fact1: An octopus can taste with its arms.
facts.fact2: An octopus can only taste with its mouth.

facts.fact1: Polar bears have black skin under their transparent fur.
facts.fact2: Polar bears have pink skin under their fur.

facts.fact1: The human liver can regenerate itself even if a large portion is removed.
facts.fact2: The human liver cannot regenerate.

facts.fact1: The longest cell in the human body is the motor neuron.
facts.fact2: The longest cell in the human body is the red blood cell.

facts.fact1: The international telephone code for Antarctica is +672.
facts.fact2: Antarctica has no international telephone code.

facts.fact1: Cheetahs cannot roar; they can only purr.
facts.fact2: Cheetahs can roar like lions.

facts.fact1: Wombats produce cube-shaped droppings.
facts.fact2: Wombats produce spherical droppings.

facts.fact1: Sound travels about four times faster in water than in air.
facts.fact2: Sound travels at the same speed in air and water.

facts.fact1: The blue whale is the loudest animal on Earth.
facts.fact2: Lions are the loudest animals on Earth.

facts.fact1: The Eiffel Tower was initially intended as a temporary installation.
facts.fact2: The Eiffel Tower was always planned to be permanent.

facts.fact1: A hummingbird’s heart can beat over 1,000 times per minute.
facts.fact2: A hummingbird’s heart beats slower than a human's.

facts.fact1: A species of fungus (Armillaria) can cover over 2,000 acres, making it one of the largest living organisms.
facts.fact2: Fungi are always small and cannot cover large areas.

facts.fact1: The term 'astronaut' comes from Greek words meaning 'star sailor'.
facts.fact2: The term 'astronaut' comes from Latin words meaning 'sky traveler'.

facts.fact1: The skin is the human body’s largest organ.
facts.fact2: The liver is the human body’s largest organ.

facts.fact1: The Mona Lisa has her own mailbox at the Louvre due to the letters she receives.
facts.fact2: The Mona Lisa does not receive mail.

facts.fact1: No two humans have identical fingerprints.
facts.fact2: Identical twins have identical fingerprints.

facts.fact1: Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a storm that has lasted for centuries.
facts.fact2: Jupiter's Great Red Spot formed only a few decades ago.

facts.fact1: Gold is edible and is used decoratively in some culinary dishes.
facts.fact2: Gold is toxic and cannot be safely ingested.

facts.fact1: Gallium can melt in your hand.
facts.fact2: No metal melts at human body temperature.

facts.fact1: Rabbits produce cecotropes which they re-ingest for nutrients.
facts.fact2: Rabbits digest their food only once.

facts.fact1: Humans cannot breathe underwater without equipment because our lungs can't extract oxygen from water.
facts.fact2: Humans can train themselves to breathe underwater naturally.

facts.fact1: Birds are the closest living relatives of dinosaurs.
facts.fact2: Crocodiles are more closely related to dinosaurs than birds.

facts.fact1: Venus does not have any moons.
facts.fact2: Venus has two small moons.

facts.fact1: A honey mushroom colony in Oregon is considered one of the largest organisms by area.
facts.fact2: The African elephant is considered the largest organism by area.

facts.fact1: Polar bears have slightly webbed front paws to aid in swimming.
facts.fact2: Polar bears' paws have no webbing at all.

facts.fact1: Cats have whiskers on their legs as well as their face.
facts.fact2: Cats only have whiskers on their face.

facts.fact1: A newborn kangaroo is about the size of a lima bean.
facts.fact2: A newborn kangaroo is about the size of a fully grown mouse.

facts.fact1: The platypus, a mammal, lays eggs.
facts.fact2: All mammals give birth to live young.

facts.fact1: Butterflies can see ultraviolet light.
facts.fact2: Butterflies see only the same wavelengths as humans.

facts.fact1: Caffeine is found in the seeds, leaves, and fruits of some plants.
facts.fact2: Caffeine is only found in coffee beans.

facts.fact1: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
facts.fact2: A group of flamingos is called only a 'flock'.

facts.fact1: Jellyfish have existed on Earth for over 500 million years.
facts.fact2: Jellyfish have existed for only a few million years.

facts.fact1: The tilt of the Earth’s axis causes the seasons.
facts.fact2: The Earth's distance from the Sun causes the seasons.

facts.fact1: Beethoven was completely deaf by the time he composed his Ninth Symphony.
facts.fact2: Beethoven had normal hearing when he composed his Ninth Symphony.

facts.fact1: The blue-ringed octopus is one of the most venomous marine animals.
facts.fact2: The blue-ringed octopus is harmless to humans.

facts.fact1: The Colosseum in Rome could hold around 50,000 to 80,000 spectators.
facts.fact2: The Colosseum in Rome could hold only about 5,000 spectators.

facts.fact1: The DNA in each human cell, if uncoiled, would be about 2 meters long.
facts.fact2: Human DNA in each cell is only a few millimeters long when uncoiled.

facts.fact1: Mercury is the closest planet to Earth on average.
facts.fact2: Venus is the closest planet to Earth on average.

facts.fact1: The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth.
facts.fact2: A giant sequoia is the largest living structure on Earth.

facts.fact1: Albert Einstein once declined the presidency of Israel.
facts.fact2: Albert Einstein served as president of Israel.

facts.fact1: Spiders usually have eight eyes.
facts.fact2: Spiders usually have two eyes.

facts.fact1: The world's largest flower, Rafflesia arnoldii, can reach over 3 feet in diameter.
facts.fact2: The world's largest flower is the sunflower.

facts.fact1: A single strand of spider silk can be stronger than steel.
facts.fact2: Spider silk is weaker than cotton.

facts.fact1: The giant squid has the largest eyes in the animal kingdom.
facts.fact2: The giraffe has the largest eyes in the animal kingdom.

facts.fact1: Human beings are the only species known to cook their food.
facts.fact2: Several other animal species are known to cook their food.

facts.fact1: Venus is the closest planet to Earth in size and mass.
facts.fact2: Mars is the closest planet to Earth in size and mass.

facts.fact1: The Andes is the longest continental mountain range.
facts.fact2: The Himalayas is the longest continental mountain range.

facts.fact1: Sharks have been around longer than trees.
facts.fact2: Trees existed before sharks.

facts.fact1: A grizzly bear’s bite can crush a bowling ball.
facts.fact2: A grizzly bear’s bite is no stronger than a human’s.

facts.fact1: Dolphins give themselves names through signature whistles.
facts.fact2: Dolphins do not use individual identities.

facts.fact1: Chocolate was once used as currency by the Mayans.
facts.fact2: Chocolate has never been used as currency.

facts.fact1: Lightning strikes about 100 times per second worldwide.
facts.fact2: Lightning strikes only a few times per hour worldwide.

facts.fact1: It can snow in the Sahara Desert, though rarely.
facts.fact2: It never snows in the Sahara Desert.

facts.fact1: The oldest continuously inhabited city is believed to be Jericho.
facts.fact2: The oldest continuously inhabited city is believed to be Rome.

facts.fact1: The term 'OK' came from a playful misspelling of 'all correct' as 'oll korrect'.
facts.fact2: The term 'OK' originated as a Native American word.

facts.fact1: Olympus Mons on Mars is about three times the height of Mount Everest.
facts.fact2: Olympus Mons on Mars is smaller than Mount Everest.

facts.fact1: Avocados are fruits, not vegetables.
facts.fact2: Avocados are classified as vegetables.

facts.fact1: Humans are born with about 300 bones, which fuse down to 206 by adulthood.
facts.fact2: Humans are born with 206 bones and that number never changes.

facts.fact1: The world's deepest postbox is underwater in Susami Bay, Japan.
facts.fact2: All postboxes are located on land.

facts.fact1: The Greenland shark can live for over 400 years.
facts.fact2: The Greenland shark lives about 30 years.

facts.fact1: Human saliva contains opiorphin, a natural painkiller.
facts.fact2: Human saliva does not contain any painkilling substances.

facts.fact1: The scent of chocolate increases theta brain waves, which promote relaxation.
facts.fact2: The scent of chocolate has no effect on brain waves.

facts.fact1: A narwhal’s tusk is actually a long, spiral tooth.
facts.fact2: A narwhal’s tusk is a horn made of keratin.

facts.fact1: The kiwi bird lays eggs that are large relative to its body size, the largest ratio of egg to body weight.
facts.fact2: The ostrich lays the largest egg relative to its body size.

facts.fact1: The speed of a computer mouse can be measured in 'Mickeys'.
facts.fact2: The speed of a computer mouse is measured in 'Clicks'.

facts.fact1: Some dragonflies form a heart shape with their tails while mating.
facts.fact2: No insects form recognizable shapes while mating.

facts.fact1: Saturn’s rings are made mostly of ice particles.
facts.fact2: Saturn’s rings are made mostly of rock.

facts.fact1: In ancient Greece, the gymnasium was a place where people often exercised naked.
facts.fact2: In ancient Greece, the gymnasium was strictly for philosophical debates.

facts.fact1: An eagle’s eyesight is up to eight times sharper than a human’s.
facts.fact2: An eagle’s eyesight is about the same as a human’s.

facts.fact1: A day on Neptune lasts about 16 Earth hours.
facts.fact2: A day on Neptune lasts about 40 Earth hours.

facts.fact1: The Colugo, or ‘flying lemur’, can glide over 100 meters.
facts.fact2: The Colugo can only jump a few meters.

facts.fact1: The surface area of a human lung is roughly equal to a tennis court.
facts.fact2: The surface area of a human lung is about the size of a small notebook.

facts.fact1: Camels have three eyelids to protect their eyes from sand.
facts.fact2: Camels have only one eyelid per eye.

facts.fact1: The oceans contain roughly 20 million tons of dissolved gold.
facts.fact2: The oceans contain no dissolved gold.

facts.fact1: Humans get a completely new skeleton approximately every 10 years due to bone remodeling.
facts.fact2: The human skeleton remains the same once adulthood is reached.

facts.fact1: The Amazon River discharges about 209,000 cubic meters of water per second.
facts.fact2: The Amazon River discharges about 1,000 cubic meters of water per second.

facts.fact1: Cacti perform photosynthesis mainly through their stems.
facts.fact2: Cacti perform photosynthesis mainly through their roots.

facts.fact1: Sharks do not have bones; their skeletons are made of cartilage.
facts.fact2: Sharks have bones just like other fish.

facts.fact1: The 'P' in 'P.T. Barnum' stands for Phineas.
facts.fact2: The 'P' in 'P.T. Barnum' stands for Paul.

facts.fact1: Saturn’s moon Titan has lakes and seas of liquid methane.
facts.fact2: Titan’s surface has no liquid bodies.

facts.fact1: Dogs have about 1,700 taste buds compared to about 9,000 in humans.
facts.fact2: Dogs have more taste buds than humans.

facts.fact1: The Richter scale is logarithmic, meaning each whole number step represents a 10-fold increase in amplitude.
facts.fact2: The Richter scale is linear, representing equal increments.

facts.fact1: Jupiter has more than 70 known moons.
facts.fact2: Jupiter has fewer than 10 known moons.

facts.fact1: The world’s largest amphibian is the Chinese giant salamander.
facts.fact2: The world’s largest amphibian is the Goliath frog.

facts.fact1: At room temperature, most metals are solid except mercury.
facts.fact2: All metals are solid at room temperature.

facts.fact1: Chameleons change color primarily to communicate or express mood.
facts.fact2: Chameleons change color only for camouflage.

facts.fact1: The archerfish can shoot jets of water to knock insects off branches.
facts.fact2: The archerfish only eats insects that fall into the water naturally.

facts.fact1: The Taj Mahal is constructed mainly of white marble.
facts.fact2: The Taj Mahal is constructed mainly of red sandstone.

facts.fact1: Some turtles can breathe through their rear openings (cloacal respiration).
facts.fact2: Turtles cannot breathe except through their lungs.

facts.fact1: Some fish, like clownfish, can change their sex during their lifetime.
facts.fact2: No fish species can change their sex.

facts.fact1: Chili peppers evolved their spiciness to deter mammals, not birds.
facts.fact2: Chili peppers evolved spiciness to deter birds, not mammals.

facts.fact1: Ancient Egyptians shaved off their eyebrows to mourn the death of their cats.
facts.fact2: Ancient Egyptians never altered their appearance in mourning.

facts.fact1: The longest English word included in major dictionaries is pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis.
facts.fact2: Antidisestablishmentarianism is the longest English word.

facts.fact1: 'Gadsby' is a novel written without using the letter 'e'.
facts.fact2: 'Gadsby' uses all letters of the alphabet frequently.

facts.fact1: A female ferret can die if she remains in heat without mating.
facts.fact2: A female ferret can stay in heat indefinitely without harm.

facts.fact1: A con artist named Victor Lustig famously 'sold' the Eiffel Tower twice.
facts.fact2: The Eiffel Tower has never been 'sold' fraudulently.

facts.fact1: Adult cats meow primarily to communicate with humans, not other cats.
facts.fact2: Adult cats commonly meow to each other.

facts.fact1: India’s constitution includes provisions protecting cows.
facts.fact2: India’s constitution does not mention cows.

facts.fact1: Gorillas can catch human colds and other illnesses.
facts.fact2: Gorillas are immune to human diseases.

facts.fact1: Sea otters hold each other’s paws while sleeping so they don’t drift apart.
facts.fact2: Sea otters never touch each other while resting.

facts.fact1: The scent of lavender can promote relaxation and improve sleep quality.
facts.fact2: The scent of lavender has no effect on relaxation.

facts.fact1: Ants can lift objects up to 50 times their body weight.
facts.fact2: Ants can only lift about twice their body weight.

facts.fact1: The peregrine falcon can reach speeds over 200 mph in a dive.
facts.fact2: The peregrine falcon’s top speed is about 50 mph.

facts.fact1: Starfish (sea stars) can regenerate lost arms.
facts.fact2: Starfish cannot regenerate any lost body parts.

facts.fact1: Owls can rotate their heads up to 270 degrees.
facts.fact2: Owls can only rotate their heads about 90 degrees.

facts.fact1: Prehistoric giant beavers once grew to the size of bears.
facts.fact2: Beavers have always been the same size.

facts.fact1: The world’s smallest reptile is a chameleon species (Brookesia nana) from Madagascar.
facts.fact2: The world’s smallest reptile is a gecko from the Amazon.

facts.fact1: In space, astronauts can become about 2 inches taller due to reduced spinal compression.
facts.fact2: Astronauts remain the same height in space.

facts.fact1: A rhinoceros horn is made of keratin, like human hair and nails.
facts.fact2: A rhinoceros horn is made of bone.

facts.fact1: Monarch butterflies migrate over 2,500 miles to central Mexico.
facts.fact2: Monarch butterflies do not migrate.

facts.fact1: Lake Baikal in Russia is the deepest lake in the world.
facts.fact2: Lake Tanganyika is the deepest lake in the world.

facts.fact1: The wandering albatross has the largest wingspan of any living bird.
facts.fact2: The Andean condor has the largest wingspan of any living bird.

facts.fact1: Gorillas can laugh when they are tickled.
facts.fact2: Gorillas cannot produce laughter-like sounds.

facts.fact1: Antarctica's 'Blood Falls' glacier seeps iron-rich water that appears red.
facts.fact2: No glaciers appear red in Antarctica.

facts.fact1: Some bamboo species can grow up to a meter (about 3 feet) in one day.
facts.fact2: Bamboo grows at a similar rate to oak trees.

facts.fact1: A group of jellyfish is called a 'smack'.
facts.fact2: A group of jellyfish is called a 'school' only.

facts.fact1: A starfish (sea star) has no brain.
facts.fact2: A starfish has a centralized brain.

facts.fact1: The Carolina Reaper is currently recognized as one of the world’s hottest chili peppers.
facts.fact2: The Jalapeño is the hottest chili pepper in the world.

facts.fact1: Elephants are among the few animals that recognize themselves in a mirror.
facts.fact2: Elephants cannot recognize themselves in mirrors.

facts.fact1: There are more plastic flamingos in the world than real ones.
facts.fact2: There are more real flamingos than plastic ones.

facts.fact1: The Greenland ice sheet is the second largest body of ice after Antarctica.
facts.fact2: The Greenland ice sheet is the largest body of ice in the world.

facts.fact1: Antarctica is the only continent without reptiles or snakes.
facts.fact2: Asia has no native snakes.

facts.fact1: Babies have about 100 more bones than adults.
facts.fact2: Babies have the same number of bones as adults.

facts.fact1: Rattlesnakes add a new segment to their rattle each time they shed.
facts.fact2: Rattlesnakes are born with a full-length rattle.

facts.fact1: Bald eagles are not actually bald; 'bald' once meant 'white-headed'.
facts.fact2: Bald eagles have no feathers on their head.

facts.fact1: Horses can sleep both lying down and standing up.
facts.fact2: Horses can only sleep lying down.

facts.fact1: A blue whale’s arteries are so large that a small human could crawl through them.
facts.fact2: A blue whale’s arteries are too small for a human to fit.

facts.fact1: Neil Armstrong said, 'one small step for (a) man, one giant leap for mankind.'
facts.fact2: Neil Armstrong said, 'one small step for men, one giant leap for mankind.'
